title: Telesat buys SpaceX launches for Lightspeed internet satellites
summary: PARIS – Competitors or not, SpaceX continues to be willing to launch for other satellite internet companies.

title: Has Avio Begun Developing a Second-Gen Space Rider Vehicle?
summary:
In a presentation outlining the company’s half-year financial results, Italian rocket builder Avio appeared to indicate that development of a second generation of the ESA-funded reusable Space Rider vehicle has begun. Space Rider is an uncrewed robotic laboratory that is the size of around two minivans. It is designed to be capable of remaining in […]
The post Has Avio Begun Developing a Second-Gen Space Rider Vehicle? appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: ITU emphasizes importance of space sustainability
summary: The head of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) says the agency will emphasize space sustainability as the number of satellites grows.

title: Geost payloads selected for Space Development Agency satellites
summary: Geost, a supplier of optical sensor payloads for military satellites, announced Sept. 11 it won a contract to produce eight payloads for missile-tracking satellites that Northrop Grumman is building for the U.S. Space Development Agency.

title: U.S. export credit agency is working through $5 billion pipeline of space financing, vice chair says
summary: PARIS – The U.S. export credit agency is working through a $5 billion pipeline of applications related to the space industry, as companies look to fund projects in orbit in a tighter capital market.
